title: IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB
introduction: MongoDB is a JSON document store with a rich query and aggregation framework.

section_recommended.title: Getting Started
section_recommended.description: A brief tutorial to introduce using an IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB deployment.

section_recommended.title: Setting the Admin Password
section_recommended.description: The IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB service is provisioned with a admin user. You must set the admin password before you use it to connect.

section_recommended.title: Getting Connection Strings
section_recommended.description: To connect to IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB, you need some users and connection strings.

tiles.title: New hosting models
tiles.description: You can choose between two hosting models: Isolated Compute and Shared Compute. Isolated Compute is a secure single-tenant offering for complex, highly performant enterprise workloads. Shared Compute is a flexible multi-tenant offering for dynamic, fine-tuned, and decoupled capacity selections.

tiles.title: Databases for MongoDB End of life announcement: Version 5 reaches end of life on September 25, 2024
tiles.description: All IBM Cloud® Databases for MongoDB instances on deprecated versions that are still active will be upgraded in-place to the next major version. We recommend that you upgrade following our backup and restore process before the EOL date of your version. For more information, see Upgrading to a new Major Version.

tiles.title: Databases for MongoDB version 6 released
tiles.description: Databases for MongoDB version 6 is now available. For more information, see Upgrading to a new Major Version.
